epiviz 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Reference

    All functions

    adorn_dates()

    A function to add assorted date lookups to an existing dataframe with a date variable.

    agesex_pyramid_grouped()

    Age Sex Pyramid using grouped data

    age_sex_pyramid()

    Generate an Age-Sex Pyramid

    base_gg()

    Creates base ggplot object for use across other functions. Parameters are not passed explicitly to the function, so function call needs to be proceeded by environment(base_gg) <- environment()

    base_plotly()

    Creates base plotly object for use across other functions. Parameters are not passed explicitly to the function, so function call needs to be proceeded by environment(base_plotly) <- environment()

    col_chart()

    Column Chart

    datebreak_to_d3()

    Function to convert ggplot scale_date(date_breaks) values to d3 date format for use in plotly dtick variable for date axis break setting.

    epi_curve()

    epi_curve

    epi_map()

    epi_map

    get_os()

    Function for determining user's operating system credit: https://www.r-bloggers.com/2015/06/identifying-the-os-from-r/

    html_bold()

    Function to apply html bold tags to input text strings for use in plotly font definitions.

    inv_scale_function()

    Function to scale/shift secondary y axis data

    lab_data

    Synthetic Lab Data for EpiViz functions

    line_chart()

    A function for producing either static (ggplot) or dynamic (plotly) line charts.

    llm_interpret()

    Interpret Epidemiological Data or Visualisations using LLMs

    London_LA_boundaries_2023

    Local Authority Districts (May 2023) Boundaries for London BGC

    palette_gen()

    A function to generate a colour palette of n_pal hexcodes based upon an input colour (or colours) x

    param_assign()

    Function to assign list elements to variables within the parent environment. Compares input list against a reference vector of expected list elements, and assigns any that it cannot find a value of 'NULL'.

    param_rename()

    A function to rename an item in a named list

    PHEC_boundaries_2016

    PHEC (Dec 2016) Generalised Clipped Boundaries in England

    plotly_legend_pos()

    Function to convert ggplot legend positions into list of parameters for plotly layout

    plotly_line_style()

    Function to translate ggplot linetypes into plotly linetypes

    point_chart()

    point_chart

    process_line_list_for_age_sex_pyramid()

    Process Line List for Age-Sex Pyramid

    scale_function()

    Function to scale/shift secondary y axis labels

    set_Arial()

    Function to set chart_font variable to Arial in order to resolve warnings

    UK_boundaries_2023

    Countries (December 2023) Boundaries UK BUC

    Contents

    Developed by Harshana Liyanage, Alex Bhattacharya, Liam Fitzpatrick, James Leatherland, Sudha Aurumugam, Jordan Worth, James Duke, Emma Parker.
